meanings.definition: A system of radio navigation in which signals are transmitted from multiple ground stations to provide aircraft with accurate position information.
meanings.sent1: Pilots rely on omniranges to know exactly where they are flying.
meanings.sent2: The omniranges helped the plane stay on course during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The confused pilot mistakenly thought the omniranges were sending secret messages.
meanings.sent4: In the vast sky, the omniranges acted as guiding stars for the lost aircraft.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the omniranges illuminated the path for the airplane.

meanings.definition: The ability to receive signals from all directions simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The animal's omniranges allowed it to sense danger approaching from any side.
meanings.sent2: The omniranges of the security system ensured no blind spots in the building.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's omniranges made them the ultimate lookout for the city.
meanings.sent4: Her omniranges of perception were so sharp, she could anticipate any move.
meanings.sent5: The omniranges of the radar covered every angle, leaving no area unchecked.
